name: Adobe Commerce
title: Adobe Commerce
description: How to integrate Adobe Commerce with Make.com

children.text: Magento Commerce is an e-commerce platform for building and managing online stores, handling products, orders, and customers. Integrating Magento Commerce with Make.com enables automated order processing, inventory updates, and customer data synchronization across multiple business systems.

This is AI-generated content based on official Adobe Commerce documentation. The content may contain mistakes. Please verify important information. If you have questions on vendor documentation, contact
To use the Adobe Commerce app in Make,
you must have an active Adobe Commerce account and authenticate using either OAuth 10a tokens or Adobe IMS access tokens,
create your account on Adobe Commerce
To get started, you must first create a connection between Adobe Commerce and
, allowing the two services to communicate.
Obtain your Access Token in your Adobe Commerce account
Obtain your Access Token in your Adobe Commerce account
Before you create the connection in
You will use this value while creating a connection in
Because the UI might have changed, the steps you see on your screen might be different,
check the vendor documentation for updates.
, add the Adobe Commerce module to your
If you add a module with an instant tag, click
field, enter a name for the connection.
you copied from your Adobe Commerce account or follow the on-screen instructions to create the connection.
For detailed information on connecting an application, see
After connecting to the Adobe Commerce app, you can choose from a list of available modules to build your
Adds a selected product to the user's shopping cart.
Generates a new empty shopping cart and quote for a specified customer if they do not already have an existing cart.
Generates a new credit memo document for a customer transaction.
Creates a new customer record in your connected application.
Creates a new product entry in your system.
Deletes a specific customer from your account using their customer ID.
Deletes a specific product from your inventory using its product SKU.
Updates the details of a specific item already present in the shopping cart.
Fetches a list of customers that match your specified search filters.
Fetches a list of customer orders that match your specified search filters.
Returns a list of products that match your specified search filters or keywords.
Retrieves detailed information about the shopping cart belonging to a specific customer.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific customer using their customer ID.
Retrieves detailed information about a product using its SKU (Stock Keeping Unit).
Retrieves detailed information for a specific order using its order ID.
Retrieves and displays the current status of a specific order.
Generates a new invoice document for a specific order.
Executes a custom API request to the connected service using your authorized credentials.
Creates a new shipment record for a specified order.
Updates the details of an existing customer using their customer ID.
Updates the details of an existing product identified by its SKU (Stock Keeping Unit).
Triggers when a new credit memo record is generated in your system.
Triggers when a new customer record is added to your system.
Triggers when a new order is placed in your system.
Triggers when a new product is added to your store.
You can look for more templates in
, where you'll find thousands of pre-created

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
